meanings.definition: A member of a military unit specially trained for carrying out raids and other special operations.
meanings.sent1: The commandoes stealthily infiltrated the enemy base under the cover of darkness.
meanings.sent2: The commandoes were deployed to rescue the hostages from the terrorist stronghold.
meanings.sent3: The commandoes decided to surprise their friends by organizing a fun treasure hunt.
meanings.sent4: The commandoes' efficiency in completing the mission was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The image of the commandoes rappelling down the cliff will forever be etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: A group of soldiers or operatives trained for special operations.
meanings.sent1: The elite commandoes assembled at the briefing room to plan their next mission.
meanings.sent2: The commandoes moved swiftly through the jungle, ready to strike at a moment's notice.
meanings.sent3: The commandoes' team spirit was evident as they tackled the obstacle course with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: The commandoes' unity was like a tightly woven fabric, unbreakable and strong.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the commandoes marching in perfect formation was truly impressive.
